answers.answer: Hi,How are you? Numbness in your hands and feet may be due to an njury to a nerve , pressure on the spinal nerves/ peripheral nerves, lack of blood supply to an area, and other medical conditions such as carpal tunnel syndrome, diabetes, transient ischemic attack (TIA), use of certain medications or vitamin deficiencies. If it persists, have this evaluated further by your doctor. Your doctor should identify and treat the underlying cause of your numbness or tingling. This may reverse the symptoms or prevent them from becoming worse. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: For about 3 years I had numbness in my great toe.  Now it has moved to encompass both feet. sometimes worse than at other times.  After being in the hospital for dehydration, which caused atrial fib, I started with numbness in my finers.  It has continued, and seems worse in the little finger and the sides of my hands.  Also the strength in my hands is worsening.    The Doctor ignores me.  I'm 70, so I understand that.  I work out at the gym, 4-5 days a week, and participate in Yoga classes 2 times a week.  Can you give me some ideas what may be causing this?I appreciate your help.
title: Numbness in hands and feet
